title.b: Resolving a VM Hostname without mDNS

section.title: Using xip.io
section.p: You can quickly set up wildcard DNS resolution by using xip.io or a similar service. xip.io provides wildcard DNS resolution for addresses in the format <IP address>.xip.io

To change the hostname of the VM, log in to the VM via SSH or the hypervisor console with the username and password and then run the kato node rename <...> command with the external IP address and the xip.io domain appended to it. For example:

This command will change the system hostname and reconfigure some internal settings. The xip.io DNS servers will resolve the domain 10.9.8.7.xip.io and all sub-domains to 10.9.8.7. This functionality is the same for private subnets and public IP addresses.
